page.title: 01SHILLINGFORD
page.content: THE AREA COVERED IS PREDOMINATLY FARMING LAND. THE PRIMARY MAJOR LAND COVER IS CROPS OTHER THAN GRASS.THE LAND IS INTENSIVELY FARMED.THE MAJORITY OF CROPS ARE SOLD FOR A CASH PROFIT. THE SECOND MAJOR LAND COVER IS INTENSIVELY MANAGED GRASSLAND.THE GRASS IS CUT FOR HAY FOR SILAGE AND USED TO FEED THE ANIMALS DURING THE WINTER PERIOD WHEN OUTSIDE GRAZING IS LIMITED. THE AREA PROVIDES LIMITED ATTRACTIVE ACCOMMADATION FOR EXETER COMMUTERS. CONSEQUENTLY HOUSING PRICES ARE HIGH. THE WHOLE AREA PROVIDES AN ABUNDANT AND GLORIOUS HABITAT FOR NUMEROUS SPECIES OF ANIMALS.THICK HEDGEROWS WOODS,STREAMS,RIVERS AND A SPARSE POPULATION ARE IDEAL CONDITIONS FOR WILDLIFE TO THRIVE.WHITE COTTAGES AND FARMS MAKE THE WHOLE AREA PICTURESQUE.
